alert.note: Alert for Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Reagan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 5:21AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT GLASSCOCK...MITCHELL... NORTHEASTERN MIDLAND...NORTHEASTERN REAGAN...SOUTHERN HOWARD AND SOUTHEASTERN MARTIN COUNTIES THROUGH 600 AM CDT... At 521 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lake Colorado City State Park to 11 miles south of Lomax. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Greenwood, Garden City, Stanton, Coahoma, Forsan, Sand Springs, Lomax, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Big Spring Country Club, Big Spring McMahon-Wrinkle Airpark, and Elbow. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 147 and 210. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Glasscock; Howard; Martin; Midland; Mitchell; Reagan
